definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Miraculously, all hte passengers on the coach survived.
sentences.chinese: 长途汽车上所有的乘客都奇迹般地活下来了。

sentences.english: We went to the World Park by coach from Sunshine Town.
sentences.chinese: 我们从阳光城乘长途汽车去世界公园。

sentences.english: He came to New York from SanFrancisco through Chicago by greyhound bus.
sentences.chinese: 他从旧金山坐长途汽车经过芝加哥到纽约。

sentences.english: The trip from my school took about two hours by coach.
sentences.chinese: 从我们学校出发的旅行乘长途汽车要花约两个小时。

sentences.english: We like to travel by coach.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢乘长途汽车旅行。

sentences.english: Outside the room there was a big open ground where many long-distance buses were parking.
sentences.chinese: 房外后头是一大片空地，停满了长途汽车。

sentences.english: I wanted to go there, but the journey is distance, needing to take a long-distance bus.
sentences.chinese: 很想去，但路途不近，需坐长途汽车。

sentences.english: The coach jolted its passengers terribly over the miserable road.
sentences.chinese: 长途汽车在很糟糕的公路上行驶，把乘客们颠得够呛。

sentences.english: A motor coach arrived with a party of tourists to see around the factory.
sentences.chinese: 观光团乘坐一辆长途汽车来到工厂参观。

sentences.english: Can I book coach tickets here?
sentences.chinese: 你这里可不可以预购长途汽车票？

sentences.english: National Express laid on extra coaches.
sentences.chinese: 国家快运也增设了额外的长途汽车。

sentences.english: Two coaches collided with each other.
sentences.chinese: 两辆长途汽车互相碰撞。

sentences.english: For safety reasons, Jiangxi Province has halted all provincial bus service.
sentences.chinese: 为了安全起见，江西省已经停开长途汽车。

definition: to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
to take the car, bus, train etc
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
